head.supplied: Botanic Garden ¶ Melbourne, 12/5/73 ¶ Sir ¶ ¶ I have the honor to submit herewith for your favorable consideration a requisition for the erection of a potting shed in one of the nurseries of the Bota...

div.p: J73/8899, unit 750, VPRS 44/P inward registered and unregistered correspondence, VA 538 Department of Crown Lands and Survey, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed by M. Botanic Garden
I have the honor to submit herewith for your favorable consideration a requisition for the erection of a potting shed in one of the nurseries of the Botanic Garden.

In regard to the Garden Seats I would respectfully suggest that the whole sum granted for this purpose, viz. £100, be expended to purchase seats from the Penal Department, which supplies them at the rate of 23 shillings each.
The site for the Urinal and two Earth Closets to be erected in the Garden I shall point out to intending tenderers.

div.p:
The Honorable the Commissioner of Public Works
M's letter was forwarded to the Commissioner of Crown Lands and Survey on 12 May 1873 'to whom [it] should have been addressed'. Casey ordered on 16 May: 'Instruct Govt Botanist that he must not Communicate with other depts except th[rou]gh the Ministerial head of his own dept. All requisitions must be forwarded in the first instance to me.' M's requisition was approved and returned to him on 19 May. See also M to J. Casey, 22 May 1873.
